translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Pairs

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  āsavasāsavaduka
translated: The Pairs and the Dependent Origination

original: Naāsavañceva naanāsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naāsavo ceva naanāsavo ca dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā. Naāsavañceva naanāsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naanāsavo ceva nano ca āsavo🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naāsavañceva naanāsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca noāsavo ceva
analyzed: na āsavañca iva na anāsavañca dhammam paṭicca na āsavaḥ ca iva na anāsavaḥ ca dhammo uppajjati  hetu paccayā na āsavañca ca iva na anāsavañca dhammam paṭicca na anāsavaḥ ca iva na no ca āsavaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na āsavañca ca iva na anāsavañca dhammam paṭicca no āsavaḥ ca iva
translated: With an uncontaminated and not inattentive state as condition there arises an uncontaminated and not inattentive state.🔽With an uncontaminated and not inattentive state as condition there arises an inattentive and not uncontaminated state.

original: naanāsavo ca naanāsavo ceva nano ca āsavo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Naanāsavañceva nano ca āsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanāsavo ceva nano ca āsavo dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naanāsavañceva nano ca āsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naāsavo ceva
analyzed: na anāsavaḥ ca na anāsavaḥ ca iva na no ca āsavo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  na anāsavam ca iva na no ca āsavam dhammam paṭicca na anāsavaḥ ca iva na no ca āsavaḥ dhammo  uppajjati hetu paccayā na anāsavam ca iva na no ca āsavam dhammam paṭicca na āsavaḥ ca iva
translated: With an uncontaminated and not inattentive state as condition there arise an inattentive and not uncontaminated state and an uncontaminated and not inattentive state.🔽With an inattentive and uncontaminated state as condition there arises an inattentive and uncontaminated state.🔽With an inattentive and uncontaminated state as condition there arises an uncontaminated and not inattentive state.

original: naanāsavo ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naanāsavañceva nano ca āsavaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: na anāsavaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na anāsavam ca iva na no ca āsavam dhamma
translated: With an inattentive and uncontaminated state as condition there arise an uncontaminated and not inattentive state and an inattentive and uncontaminated state.

original: paṭicca naāsavo ceva naanāsavo ca naanāsavo ceva nano ca āsavo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Naāsavañceva naanāsavañca naanāsavañceva nanoāsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naāsavo ceva
analyzed: paṭicca na āsavaḥ ceva na anāsavaḥ ca na anāsavaḥ ceva na no ca āsavo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  na āsavam ca iva na anāsavam ca na anāsavam ca iva na noāsavam ca dhammam paṭicca na āsavaḥ ca iva
translated: Dependent on a non-outflow and a neither-outflow-nor-in-outflow, a neither-outflow-nor-in-outflow comes to be.🔽Dependent on a non-outflow and a neither-outflow-nor-in-outflow, a non-outflow comes to be.

original: naanāsavo ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naāsavañceva naanāsavañca naanāsavañceva🔽nano ca āsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanāsavo ceva nano ca āsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Naāsavañceva naanāsavañca naanāsavañceva nanoāsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naāsavo ceva
analyzed: na anāsavaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na āsavañca ceva na anāsavañca na anāsavañca ceva  na no ca āsavam dhammam paṭicca na anāsavaḥ ca iva na no ca āsavaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  na āsavam ca iva na anāsavam ca na anāsavam ca iva na noāsavam ca dhammam paṭicca na āsavaḥ ca iva
translated: Dependent on a non-outflow and a neither-outflow-nor-in-outflow, an in-outflow comes to be.🔽Dependent on a non-outflow and a neither-outflow-nor-in-outflow, a neither-outflow-nor-in-outflow and a non-outflow come to be.

original: naanāsavo ca naanāsavo ceva nano ca āsavo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na anāsavaḥ ca na anāsavaḥ ca iva na no ca āsavaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: Dependent on a non-outflow and a neither-outflow-nor-in-outflow, a neither-outflow-nor-in-outflow and an in-outflow come to be.🔽(In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava sabbattha vitthāro
translated: Nine in terms of cause, nine in terms of object, … nine in terms of result, … nine in terms of the unincluded. (In all cases in detail.)
